page.title: 04"FOUNTAIN FORESTRY" GARTMORE
page.content: In comparison to the Forestry Commission,{Fountain Forestry}is a Scottish-based company which manages forests for various owners in Scotland, Canada and America. Around Gartmore they use Fir Hill, Crinigart Woods, and Easter and Wester Cow Park (known locally as the "Wee Wood"). As the soil is fertile and the sites sheltered many trees grow to 60 years old, with some even 100 years old. Sitka Spruce, Douglas Fir and Scots Pine are grown, but some{deciduous woods are also planted, the trees being replaced with a similar variety where possible. Larch, beech, birch, oak and rowan are grown for wood to make furniture (until recently, the birch being "turned" to make cotton reels), while the{coniferous}wood is at present sent to Norway and Sweden to make paper and chipboard.
